questions.question:
Read each situation. Write which proverb can be used for it. Use the proverbs given in the box.

Proverbs: A rising tide lifts all boats | Hard work always pays off | Tall oaks from small acorns grow | A bad workman blames his tools | The darkest hour is just before the dawn | A stitch in time saves nine | A burnt child dreads the fire | A new broom sweeps clean

1. Vera was a very careless girl. Once, her uncle presented a beautiful emerald bracelet to her. When she wore it, she noticed that the clasp was a little loose. Her mother asked her to get it repaired, but Vera paid no heed. One day, when she came home after a birthday party, she saw that she had lost the bracelet. She kept searching for it but could not find it. How she wished she had mended the clasp in the beginning!
questions.answer: A stitch in time saves nine
questions.explanation: If Vera had fixed the clasp when it was first noticed, she wouldn't have lost the bracelet.

2. Vikram completed his chart without paying much attention to matter or presentation. His mother was not surprised when his chart was not selected for display, but Vikram came up with his own reasons. He was convinced that his chart would have been selected if he had better quality sketch pens and more colourful pictures.
questions.answer: A bad workman blames his tools
questions.explanation: Instead of accepting that he didn't pay attention to his work, Vikram blamed his tools.
